p: Cameroon integrated measles surveillance in 1974 through sentinel sites in the city of Yaoundé [ 18]. The first genetic data on MeV date from 1994 with the identification of genotype B1 strain Yaounde. CAE/12. 83 "Y-14" in Yaoundé [ 14]. Virological surveillance of MeV strains in Cameroon was effectively implemented in 2011 at the National Measles Laboratory [ 16]. This study is the fourth to investigate MeV strains circulating in Cameroon [ 14– 16] and the second from the virological surveillance program set up in 2011.
